item.title: in class of colorful freshmen, meet the most contrarian
item.description: justin amash has voted against republican-backed bills more than any other party member, even if he agrees with them.

item.title: strauss-kahn case raises issue of abuse by diplomats in u.s.
item.description: the case against dominique strauss-kahn is an extreme example of alleged sexual assault by an elite member of the international community. but the charges against him also shine a light on how diplomats and international officials have been accused of abusing maids or nannies in the united states, and have largely escaped prosecution.

item.title: texas instruments misses forecasts, blames japan
item.description: chip maker texas instruments inc warned of slower-than-usual quarterly sales growth as it scrambles to restart production after japan's massive earthquake, and said it was unclear when the supply of the silicon and wafers it needs will return to normal.

item.description: the impact of apple's icloud service on file-sharing services like dropbox may be limited.

item.title: friday protests erupt in arab world
item.description: protests erupted across much of the arab world on friday, the muslim day of prayer, with demonstrators killed in syria and yemen while egyptians staged one of the biggest rallies since president hosni mubarak's fall.

item.title: verifone sees smartphones driving mobile payment wave
item.description: verifone systems inc, the largest u.s. maker of payment terminals, expects to ship well over 1 million 'near-field communications' (nfc)-enabled systems this year, underlining growing momentum for a technology that allows shoppers to buy with little more than a wave of a smartphone.
